task.title: Task: Data entry form Customers
task.shortdesc: Creation of a generated form based on one table with several manual adjustments.

context.p: In this task, you are going to create a form for entering data of new customers and editing data of existing customers. And you will practice some skills in moving and aligning controls to get the following desired format.

step.cmd: Select table Customers. It's not necessary to open the table.

step.stepresult: The form is created and displayed in Layout View.

stepsection.p: Because the form is based on table Customers, and there is a one-to-many relationship between table Customers and table Orders, a sub-datasheet based on Orders is added to the form. The sub-datasheet displays all the records in the Orders table that pertain to the current Customers record.

step.cmd: Select the sub-datasheet and press Delete.
Remove the form logo in the form header by selecting them first and then press the Delete key.
Save the form with as name Customer entry and modification with the button Save on the Quick Access Toolbar.
Make the vertical dimension (the height) of the Form Header somewhat larger by dragging the top of the Detail section somewhat downwards.
Select the text Customers in the form header label and change it in Chocolate Connoisseur.
Change some properties of the header font: name = MS Sans Serif, size = 14, italic and bold.

Select the control Label on the ribbon through tab Design Label (group Controls) and draw in the header under the first label a frame for the second label. Type the text Customer entry and modification and format it as follows: MS Sans Serif, 14 pt, bold, color black.

steps.stepsection: To be able to move the controls freely on the form, the (stacked) layout must be removed.

step.cmd: Select all controls in the section Detail by drawing a rectangle from the top left corner while holding down the left mouse button to the lower right corner. Then release the mouse button.
step.stepresult: All controls in section Detail are selected now.

step.cmd: Choose tab Arrange Remove Layout (group Table) .
Drag the controls on the form to create a design that looks as good as possible in the desired format.

tutorialinfo.p:
Some tips:
You can align selected controls with tab Arrange Align (group Sizing & Ordering
You need a new label with the text Name: in front of the text boxes first and last name.
You can set the dimensions of controls with the properties Width and Height
You can set the upper left location of a control with the properties Top and Left.
You can set the background color with the property Back Color.

step.cmd: Switch to Form View and test the form.
Close the form and save the changes.
